2:
You cover yourself with light as with a garment;\q you spread out the heavens like a tent curtain.
\q
4:
He makes the winds his messengers,\q flames of fire his servants.
\q
5:
He laid the foundations of the earth,\q and it will never be moved.


\q
6:
You covered the earth with water like a garment;\q the water covered the mountains.
\q
7:
Your rebuke made the waters recede;\q at the sound of your thunderous voice they fled.


\q
8:
The mountains rose, and the valleys spread out\q into the places that you had appointed for them.
\q
9:
You have set a boundary for them that they will not cross;\q they will not cover the earth again.


\q
10:
He made springs flow into the valleys;\q the streams flow between the mountains.
\q
11:
They supply water for all the animals of the field;\q the wild donkeys quench their thirst.
\q
12:
By the riverbanks the birds build their nests;\q they sing among the branches.


\q
13:
He waters the mountains from his water chambers in the sky.\q The earth is filled with the fruit of his labor.
\q
14:
He makes the grass grow for the cattle\q and plants for man to cultivate
\q so that man may produce food from the earth.
\q
15:
He makes wine to make man happy,\q oil to make his face shine,
\q and food to sustain his life.


\q
16:
The trees of Yahweh get plenty of rain;\q the cedars of Lebanon which he planted.
\q
17:
There the birds make their nests.\q The stork makes the cypress tree her home.
\q
18:
The wild goats live on the high mountains;\q the mountain heights are a refuge for the hyraxes.


\q
19:
He appointed the moon to mark the seasons;\q the sun knows its time for setting.
\q
20:
You make the darkness of the night\q when all the beasts of the forest come out.


\q
21:
The young lions roar for their prey\q and seek their food from God.
\q
22:
When the sun rises, they retreat\q and sleep in their dens.


\q
23:
Meanwhile, people go out to their work\q and labor away until the evening.
\q
25:
Over there is the sea, deep and wide,\q teeming with innumerable creatures,
\q both small and great.
\q
26:
The ships travel there,\q and Leviathan is also there, which you formed to play in the sea.


\q
27:
All these look to you to give them\q their food on time.
\q
28:
When you give to them, they gather;\q when you open your hand, they are satisfied.


\q
29:
When you hide your face, they are troubled;\q if you take away their breath, they die
\q and return to dust.
\q
30:
When you send out your Spirit, they are created,\q and you renew the countryside.


\q
31:
May the glory of Yahweh last forever;\q may Yahweh enjoy his creation.
\q
32:
He looks down on the earth, and it shakes;\q he touches the mountains, and they smoke.


\q
33:
I will sing to Yahweh all my life;\q I will sing praise to my God as long as I live.
\q
34:
May my thoughts be sweet to him;\q I will rejoice in Yahweh.


\q
35:
May sinners vanish from the earth,\q and let the wicked be no more.
\q I give praise to Yahweh with all my life.
\q Praise Yahweh.
